The Essentials of Taoism

Healing & Transformation: The Essentials of Taoism is an four-part introductory program for anyone interested in learning more about Taoism. Workshops will be held every Sunday in February from 1 to 5 pm at the SunDo-Taoist Yoga & Meditation Center.

The series, starting February 6, 2011, includes workshops on The Tao of Natural Breathing and Ancient Wisdom of the Tao Te Ching. In addition to discussion, participants will sample SunDo-Taoist Yoga & Meditation practice.

For a complete listing of workshops, please see the online flyer.

Participants will receive a 30-page booklet with articles and resources as a supplement to the workshops. After the last workshop on Feb 27, please join us for a group dinner at Ichiban Korean-Japanese restaurant.

 

The way you feel in your day-to-day life directly correlates with how well you breathe. Are you breathing a full, open healthy breath? Taoists believe that simply changing patterns of breathing can alter one’s perception and life experiences.

Taoist breathwork will not only bring about more physical health and well-being it also can open you to unlimited healing potential. An open healthy breath brings about a feeling of well-being that connects you with your highest good and empowers you to awaken new aspects of your life, and thus, draw in more positive experiences.

Led by Taoist Master Hyunmoon Kim, an internationally renowned teacher and director of the SunDo-Taoist Studies Graduate Program at Hanseo University in South Korea, these workshops cover all aspects of SunDo, a mountain practice maintained by hermits in the mountains of Korea. We will also focus on integrating contemporary western psychology with ancient eastern teachings.

Individual workshops are $45 or $150 for all four. If registering early by February 3, participants can pay just $130. Registrations for all four workshops will receive priority. Space is limited to 12 students and we are only accepting a maximum of three to five meetup members. Registration is required at least 48 hours in advance. So the due date for payment is February 3, 2011.
